sub_title: Asia Specialist I Community Participation I Natural Resources Management
summary:
I am a political scientist who works closely with environmental NGOs in Asia. Our goal: to support local communities, protect their environment and sustain their livelihoods and cultural values. 

Community participation in natural resources management is key in my work. Creating partnerships between environmental organizations, multi-level government institutions, knowledge institutes and industries is what I do. I work from my own consultancy Makara (part of NedWorc).

I have more than 25 years of experience in working with environmental organizations around the world. This involved staying with remote indigenous forest communities in Indonesia, discovering sacred groves in India and visiting rural indigenous women groups in Latin America. I lived in Jakarta for my research ‘Principles, Policies and People’ on the influence of international environmental principles on conservation policies and practices in Indonesia.

My current project is the AksiBrantas partnership: a long-term project funded by Dutch government - with the Indonesian environmental group Ecoton, local authorities and Dutch technical institutes TU Delft and Tauw. It is a unique partnership: Indonesian environmental activists join forces with authorities and mobilize community groups to stop household waste ending up in the river. Dutch and Indonesian experts research water quality with the latest technologies. Dutch engineers support small and medium enterprises along the river to decrease pollutants in their waste water. Sharing and learning from each other is our philosophy. Together we build a strong community-based program to protect future life in and along the river Brantas.

I am initiator of YUYU River Expeditions, an initiative to fight global river pollution at its source: in Asia, where the rivers are polluted the most, and in the Netherlands, where part of the plastic waste in Asian rivers originates. YUYU Expeditions are traveling exhibitions that are designed to inspire upstream communities to protect their rivers from plastic pollution. We study the ecosystems in the river and the quality of the water, and by doing so learn about the communities, life along the river and how this is affected by pollution. We visit communities that come into action and we tell their stories in the Netherlands, and facilitate them to tell them themselves, in person or online. We share our built up knowledge with Dutch policymakers and ask them to stop the illegal export of waste to Indonesia. We work closely with local environmental organizations on East Java.

treasury_media.description: The Dutch design agency NorthernLight and environmental agency Makara are launching a special initiative: the YUYU River Education Islands. YUYUs are floating islands in rivers around the world that...

projects.title: Governance, agricultural development, nature conservation and land and water distribution in Africa
projects.description: Client: Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency (Planbureau voor de Leefomgeving).  Analysis of the effects of large scale agricultural development and natural resource management schemes in Sub-Sahara Africa in a context of land and water governance. The synthesis report and nine case studies in Kenya, Liberia, Tanzania, Cameroon, and Uganda - are co-conducted by scientists and experts affiliated with NGOs working in the region.  Based on the case studies findings, the analysis provides insight in the  strategies applied by African local and national governments, international and local companies, and civil society organizations in distributing and trading land and water.

projects.title: Versterking milieu organisaties in Indonesie, Uganda en Bolivia
projects.description: Opdrachtgever: Hivos. Projectleider voor het Indonesie programma. Het project heeft nieuwe, pionerende milieu organisaties beter op de kaart gezet. Dankzij strategic planning, training en fondsenwerving zijn zij beter in staat hun achterban uit bouwen en milieu problemen aan te kaarten bij hun lokale overheid.

contributors.headline: Asia Specialist I Community Participation I Natural Resources Management

projects.title: 'South-South learning through a new approach for River Basin Management'
projects.description: Client: PSO. Developing the Negotiated Approach Concept and Principles and formulation of recommendations based on analysis of 6 success cases in India, Peru, Costa Rica, Bangladesh, Brasil and Indonesia.  Analysis was done with 6 NGOs experienced in negotiating for fair and sustainable water management in their countries. Involving Communities is made to inspire NGOs who wish to tackle unfair and unsustainable IWRM management practices in their countries. The project 'South-South learning through a new approach for River Basin Management' resulted in the publication 'Involving Communities:  a Guide to the Negotiated Approach in Integrated Water Resources Management' and it won the PSO Innovation Award.

profile_positions.description:
With my advice agency Makara, we connect Asian environmental organisations with parties in the Netherlands that have the knowledge and tools to increase their impact. Think, for example, of advanced measuring instruments from a Dutch university, or cultural institutions and parties from the creative industry. 

We also connect Dutch organizations that want to set up projects in Asia and collaborate with local organizations to tackle transboundary environmental problems, such as plastic pollution or large-scale deforestation. We bring them into contact with environmental organizations that have the local knowledge and network. See for example www.yuyu.earth, an initiative with the Dutch design agency NorthernLight and our Indonesian environmental NGO partner Ecoton.
profile_positions.title: Founder Makara (part of NedWorc)

profile_positions.description:
Connecting children along rivers around the world

Makara, environmental organisation ECOTON and Dutch creative agency NorthernLight are launching a new initiative: YUYU. The aim of YUYU is to empower children to think critically and take action in environmental solutions for river pollution through local and connected educational programs, creative workshops and hands-on river activities. YUYU will be a global network of floating education islands located in rivers around the world.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder YUYU River Education Islands

profile_positions.description: Advisor Community Participation in the RVO funded Public Private Partnership "Fostering inclusive growth, health and equity by mainstreaming water quality in River Basin Management in the Brantas River Basin Management in Indonesia". With the Indonesian environmental group Ecoton, local authorities, Dutch technical institutes TU Delft and Tauw. Advisor to Ecoton and local authorities on gender sensitive community involvement in integrated water resources management in Brantas basin, Indonesia. Also developer of spin off activities.
profile_positions.title: Advisor in Public Private Partnership on water quality in river basin management in Brantas basin

company.name: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education

profile_positions.company: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education
profile_positions.description: Initiator and NGO Liaison for the workshop "Answering the Challenges of Jakarta's Groundwater problems" organized by the Indonesian NGO Amrta and UNESCO/IHE Delft. The workshop was attended by the Jakarta Governor Anies and his office representatives, Indonesian NGOs and universities and Dutch and Japanese knowledge institutes. It established connections to address the identified priority activities.
profile_positions.title: Initiator, facilitator of the workshop "Answering the Challenges of Jakarta's Groundwater problems"

company.name: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education

profile_positions.company: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education
profile_positions.description: I acted as liaison between IHE Delft and Indonesian partners (NGO Amrta and Risdekti researcher) during the development phase of the NWO proposal and provided feedback on the draft proposal. The research aims to support policies of the city of Semarang on flood risk reduction while increasing access to water supply for most vulnerable residents. This requires integrated management of water resources flowing across different urban water infrastructure systems, above and below ground. The research approaches this integration through a practice based analysis of groundwater governance.
profile_positions.title: Advisor and NGO Liaison in the development of the  NWO WOTRO proposal "Ground Up"

profile_positions.description: Initiator and co-writer of a proposal for the Public Private Partnership "Fostering inclusive growth, health and equity by mainstreaming water quality in River Basin Management in the Brantas River Basin Management in Indonesia" to the RVO Sustainable Water Fund. I also acted as a go-between for the Dutch and Indonesian partners.
profile_positions.title: Initiator and developer of a proposal for a Public Private Partnership in Indonesia

profile_positions.description:
•	Design of long-term capacity building strategies for NGOs aimed at community empowerment in negotiation processes in Integrated Water Resources Management.
•	Linking NGOs to Dutch centres of expertise and companies to combine community based research (community mapping, livelihood and activity analysis) with scientific data, expertise and models 
•	Develop lobby and advocacy strategies on community involvement in Integrated Water Resources Management, especially in relation to the National Capital Integrated Development (NCICD) plan in Jakarta.
•	Initiate the Indonesia Water Community of Practice: a network of Indonesian local CSOs that stand for increased community participation in the management of ‘their’ river.

•	Coordination and management of a portfolio of capacity building projects involving CSO  networks in Eastern Europe, Asia, Africa and Latin America

profile_positions.description:

•	Developing strategic partnerships with local NGOs and Dutch science based institutes and private companies, including exploring a possible PPP for the Sustainable Water Fund (FDW 2) with a Dutch brewery and an Indonesian CSO

volunteer_experiences.description:
CSO’s from Asia, Latin America and Africa increasingly share the conviction that successful and effective water resources management is only possible if communities have the capacity and opportunity to develop and negotiate their own visions and solutions to challenges related to water resources management. In December 2014, a group of Indonesian NGOs decided to join forces and initiate the IndoWater Community of Practice. This Community of Practice aspires to contribute tangible models for community participation in IWRM, while strongly addressing the often destructive impacts of failing river basin management in national policy making. 

See http://indowatercop.org/

XminusY supports social movements, actiongroups and changemakers who are fighting for a fair, democratic, sustainable and tolerant world. Projects that are supported by XminusY can take place on a broad variety of topics. But more important then the topic, is that the people involved take action themselves to change their own society. 

See https://xminy.nl/english/
